title.narrative: 209 EMERGENCY / DISASTER RISK REDUCATION (DRR)

description.narrative: UNICEF COs and partners are supported by ROSA to have strengthened emergency preparedness plans and response to natural hazards and man-made crises robust security, risk/safety management and effective strategies for disaster risk reduction and climate change adaptation that contribute to resilience building via risk-informed programming., which contributes to Disaster Risk Reduction, Disaster Risk Reduction (Covid), Technical Excellence In Humanitarian Action (Covid), Technical Excellence In Policy And Programmes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Comprehensive, sustainable and enabling environment that leaves no child behind is supported by policies, programmes, strategies, budgets and actions of Governments, regional institutions, private sector, media, financial institutions, UN and UNICEF country programmes in South Asia, in development and humanitarian contexts.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: UNICEF COs and partners are supported by ROSA to have strengthened emergency preparedness plans and response to natural hazards andman-made crises; robust security, risk/safety management and; effective strategies for disaster risk reduction and climate changeadaptation that contribute to resilience building via risk-informed programming.

description.narrative: UNICEF ROSA supported;eight country offices in planning, advocacy, resource mobilization, implementation and monitoring of;responses to COVID-19 and seasonal cyclonic storms and floods in Bangladesh, India and Nepal. Significant technical and surge support was provided to Afghanistan to ensure timely preparedness and response to the deteriorating humanitarian situation, as well as the protracted Rohingya response in Bangladesh. Investments in strengthening regional and national capacities for emergency preparedness and contingency planning, ensuring adherence to UNICEF standards continued. The rollout of the revised CCCs and Humanitarian Review workstreams was initiated but impacted by the prioritization of COVID-19 and Afghanistan response. | Status:Met | As-of Date:20/12/2021
